Dear Bob:
As you know, I have written to the producers of several of the
series carried in the NAEB Network concerning their possible
release for use in the AERT-DAVI Tape Recording Project. One
question has come up which will have a bearing on whether or
not we will be able to utilize this program source.
In a letter to Ralph Hall, you stated that you would make
masters for the Listen America Series, produced by the Univer¬
sity of North Carolina, at a charge of $2.00 per reel. The
project does not have funds to make such payment possible*
My question is this$ do we have the right to make our own
masters as we do with other programs? or, is it necessary for
us to have you prepare masters of those programs in the NAEB
Network listings which we wish to carry? If the latter is
true, there is no point in our going further in our negotia¬
tions with the producers.
In the past, we have worked in one of the two following ways:
(l) Either the producer sent tapes to Kent State,
recordings were made and the original tapes
returned to the producer, or
FLORENCE IH-CHI FAN

(2) the producer prepared masters and sent them to
Kent and we reimbursed them for the tape used
to produce the masters.
In other words, there was a mailing of tape, but no financial
payment.
I will be at your meeting in Atlanta, and would appreciate some
clearance of this matter at that time if you do not find time to
reply by letter earlier.
Sincerely,
ALH:JMC Associate Executive Secretary
